page.title: 02STEPNEY HILL FARM
page.content: Mr Tyson's 160 acre farm is 2 miles N.W. of Scarborough.It is mainly cattle but he also has other animals. 145 ewes,230 lambs,4 rams,6 hens and 1 cockerel. There are 94 cows,61 heifers and 7 calves. Each cow yields 5300 lts per year for which the farmer gets 15p per litre giving about Â£800 per cow per year.In Winter cows sleep in small cubicles and feed on silage and dairy nuts.In Summer they are outdoors and eat grass. Cows diseases are mastitus,clots in the milk and lameness.The farm has been established for 16 years.Milk is sent to Northern Dairies in Hull.The Common Market limits the amount of milk produced on each farm. Milking in the herringbone parlour takes two and a half hours. Mr Tyson auctions his cows at Seamer Market every Monday.
